description:
Good for your plants—and the planet

Our organic dry fertilizer is designed to support big blooms using the power of nature. It’s formulated with low nitrogen to reduce leafy growth and instead favors phosphorus and potassium to support flowering. Its rich nutrient profile is derived from sources like sustainably composted turkey meal to build organic matter in your soil over time. Bonus? Applying is easy! Just open the easy-pour spout, measure, and mix it in.

sections.faq:
What’s in it?
Sunday’s new organic dry garden nutrients are intended for every garden need and for customized use.
Sunday’s Flower & Rose Garden Nutrients is ideal for flower pots & beds, both new and established. Its key nutrients—nitrogen, potassium, and phosphorus—are sourced from dried poultry litter, fish bone meal, blood meal, potassium sulfate, sulfate of potash-magnesia, kelp meal, and gypsum.
How does it work?
The formulation provides a targeted blend of organic and natural ingredients to boost blooms for flowers and roses. Our Flower & Rose Garden Nutrients offers a lower nitrogen profile to prevent excess leafy growth (an energy deterrent of flower production) - allowing your roses and blooms to take center stage. Plus, ingredients like feather meal and poultry litter are rich in carbon and help build soil organic matter over time for bountiful blooms year after year.
When is the best time to apply nutrients?
Flowers and perennial plants: Spring to summer (as long as plants aren’t heat or drought-stressed)
Trees and shrubs: Spring
Don’t fertilize woody and perennial plants in the fall; sometimes nitrogen applications to gardens in the fall can prevent dormancy and lead to plant stress and damage.
How do I use it?
Garden beds can be fertilized every 4-6 weeks during the growing season. Potted plants can be fertilized every 6 weeks during the growing season.
For new containers or flower pots, use 2 tbsp/gal or 1 cup/ft3 of soil.
For established containers/pots, use 1 tbsp for every 4” of pot diameter.
For outdoor plants like gardens, bulbs, or flower beds, use 2 cups per 25 square feet, or the entire bag for 50 square feet.
Should I treat my entire garden?
We recommend incorporating it into the soil where plantings will occur to use the product in a more targeted way—which saves you money and product for future use.
How do I use this alongside my Sunday lawn plan or fertilizer?
As long as you’re not applying products in the same area, you can apply products at the same time.
Can I use this if I’m already using another garden fertilizer product?
If you want to use another fertilizer or switch to using Sunday Garden Nutrients, we recommend waiting at least 4-6 weeks between applications to avoid over-fertilization and wasteful applications.
What's the difference between Sunday’s dry garden nutrients and liquid garden fertilizer?
Sunday’s dry garden nutrients need to be incorporated into the soil before they can break down and be taken up by plants, making it especially well-suited for use before or at planting. It also delivers greater quantities of secondary nutrients - like phosphorus to help flower and fruit production. As an added bonus, it helps build organic matter over time as it contains carbon-rich materials.
Our liquid garden fertilizer, WonderFert, can be applied any time of the season, offers a slightly more uniform application of nutrients and is quickly absorbed by the plant through foliar application. It also doesn’t require being incorporated into the soil. The downfall - the formula can separate if not shaken before use.
Do I need to wait to re-enter the space?
Pets and humans can use areas as soon as products are incorporated into the soil. Helpful Tip: pets might be attracted to the product - you can fence areas off to avoid sniffing or rolling.
Are there any US states or territories where it’s not approved for use?
OR
